intro: Pilosella floccipeduncula, commonly known as the woolly fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and other composite flowers. The plant is characterized by its dense, fluffy white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are typically gray-green with a fuzzy texture, and the stems are covered in fine, woolly hairs. Pilosella floccipeduncula thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine environments.
